skills.name: Calculate the interquartile range from a box plot
Compare two box plots using the medians
Compare two box plots using the interquartile ranges

explanations.A: I think you have found the upper quartile. The interquartile range would be the difference between the upper quartile and the lower quartile.
explanations.B: The upper quartile is 60 and the lower quartile is 30. Therefore, the interquartile range is 60 - 30 = 30 minutes.
explanations.C: I think you have found the interquartile range for the boys. The question asks for the interquartile range for the girls.
explanations.D: I think you have found the median. The question asks for the interquartile range, which is the difference between the upper quartile and lower quartile.

explanations.A: I think you have given the interquartile range for the girls. The question asks for the interquartile range for the boys.
explanations.B: I think you have stated the range. The question asks for the interquartile range, which is the difference between the upper and lower quartiles.
explanations.C: I think you have found the upper quartile. The interquartile range would be the difference between the upper quartile and the lower quartile.
explanations.D: The upper quartile is 60 and the lower quartile is 40. Therefore, the interquartile range is 60 - 40 = 20 minutes.

explanations.A: Which class has a higher median? Have you looked carefully at the vertical scale?
explanations.B: Class A has a larger median of 42 and a smaller IQR of 13, whereas class B has a median of 35 and an IQR of 21.
explanations.C: Class A has a larger median. Remember the IQR is the distance between the lower quartile and upper quartile, so the length of the box.
explanations.D: Remember that the median is the middle line of the box, and the IQR is the length of the box in this instance.

explanations.A: I think you may have miscalculated the medians. The median is the line inside the box.
explanations.B: The medians are 45 and 35, and the interquartile ranges are 17 and 24, so A has a larger median but a smaller IQR.
explanations.C: I think you may have miscalculated the interquartile ranges. Remember the IQR is the distance between the lower quartile and upper quartile, so the length of the box.
explanations.D: I think you may have mixed up Class A with Class B.

explanations.A: I think you may have misread the medians. The median is the line inside the box.
explanations.B: The measure of average on a box plot is the median. Class B has a median of 8, whereas Class A has median of 6. Therefore, Class B performed best on average.
explanations.C: I think you have confused the highest mark with the average performance. What measure of average - mode, mean or median - can we read from the box plot?
explanations.D: I think you have assumed that the IQR could be a measure of average. What measure of average - mode, mean or median - can we read from a box plot?

explanations.A: I think you have confused the highest mark with the average performance. What measure of average - mode, mean or median - can we read from the box plot?
explanations.B: I think you have assumed that the IQR could be a measure of average. What measure of average - mode, mean or median - can we read from a box plot?
explanations.C: I think you may have misread the medians. The median is the line inside the box.
explanations.D: The measure of average on a box plot is the median. In the morning the class had a median of 87.5, whereas in the afternoon the class had a median of 75. Therefore, on average, the class performed better in the morning.

explanations.A: I think you may have confused average with consistency. The measure of average shown on a boxplot is the median, which part of the boxplot shows the median?
explanations.B: I think you may have confused average with spread. The measure of average shown on a boxplot is the median, which part of the boxplot shows the median?
explanations.C: The measure of average shown on a boxplot is the median, which is marked by the line inside the box. Both groups have the same median, so on average they use their phones the same amount.
explanations.D: The measure of average shown on a boxplot is the median, which part of the boxplot shows the median?

explanations.A: Female students have a median of 40, and male students a median of 80. Therefore, male students use their phone more often, on average.
explanations.B: I think you may have assumed that a lower median means a high median. Using their phones more, means a higher median.
explanations.C: I think you may have confused average with consistency. The measure of average shown on a boxplot is the median, which part of the boxplot shows the median?
explanations.D: The measure of average shown on a boxplot is the median, which part of the boxplot shows the median?

explanations.A: Male students have a lower IQR, meaning that their phone usage is more consistent.
explanations.B: I think you may believe that a greater IQR implies more consistency.
explanations.C: I think you may have confused average and consistency. A smaller IQR would imply higher consistency.
explanations.D: I think you may have assumed that you cannot infer consistency without the original data. A smaller IQR would imply higher consistency.

explanations.A: I think you may have confused average and consistency. A smaller IQR would imply higher consistency.
explanations.B: A smaller IQR would imply higher consistency.
explanations.C: Both males and females have the same IQR in mobile phone usage, so they have the same consistency.
explanations.D: I think you may have assumed that you cannot infer consistency without the original data. A smaller IQR would imply higher consistency.
